page.title: 13Solihull Station
page.content: Solihull Station was first opened in 1852 by the Great Western Railway on the line from Snowhill,Birmingham and London Paddington. The original station was closer to Streetsbrook Road than the modern one. There have been many changes over the years. The extra lines that allowed broad and narrow guage trains to run have been removed and the footbridge has been replaced by a subway. The first train to use the station was Lord of the Isles. At one time the station was very important. It had four tracks and was on the lines between Birmingham and Oxford and Banbury and Leamington Spa. Now it is not so important. When they were testing new bridges at the station they joined up 4 of the biggest steam trains and raced them down the track. The bridges are still there.
